questions.question:
Eight people—A, B, C, D, E, F, G, and H—are seated in a row facing north, but not necessarily in that order.

A is not at either end of the row.

B is to the immediate left of C.

D sits exactly between F and G.

E sits fourth to the right of A.

C sits third to the right of G.

Who is sitting to the immediate left of D?

Six friends—P, Q, R, S, T, and U—are sitting around a circular table facing the center.

P sits third to the right of Q.

R is to the immediate left of T.

S is not an immediate neighbor of Q.

U is sitting opposite P.

Who is sitting exactly between R and Q?

Six people—X, Y, Z, W, P, and Q—live on a six-floor building, numbered 1 to 6 from bottom to top.

Y lives on an odd-numbered floor.

Only two people live between P and W.

Q lives two floors above X.

Z lives just below W.

Who lives on the top floor?

Six boxes—A, B, C, D, E, and F—are stacked one above the other.

Box A is placed two boxes above Box C.

Box B is below Box D but above Box C.

Box E is at the topmost position.

Box F is placed between Box A and Box C.

Which box is at the second position from the top?

Six people—A, B, C, D, E, and F—are sitting in a row.

A is sitting to the left of B.

C is sitting at one end.

D is sitting two places away from A.

E is between B and F.

Who is sitting at the rightmost end?

Five friends—P, Q, R, S, and T—are sitting around a circular table.

Q is second to the left of P.

R is opposite T.

S is not adjacent to P.

Who is sitting to the immediate left of Q?

A building has five floors labeled 1 to 5.

A lives on an even-numbered floor but not on the top floor.

B lives above A.

C lives on an odd-numbered floor.

Where does B live?
